meanings.definition: Extend or lie beneath something else
meanings.sent1: The rug will underlap the table, making it look neat.
meanings.sent2: The blanket underlaps the bed, keeping it warm.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally underlapped my socks, now they look mismatched!
meanings.sent4: Her kindness underlaps all the challenges she faces.
meanings.sent5: The roots of the tree underlap the ground, providing stability.

meanings.definition: To be partially covered by something else
meanings.sent1: The book will underlap the notebook on the shelf.
meanings.sent2: The painting underlaps the clock on the wall.
meanings.sent3: The cat loves to underlap the blanket, creating a cozy spot.
meanings.sent4: His excitement underlaps his nervousness about the presentation.
meanings.sent5: The flowers underlap the fence, adding beauty to the garden.
